channel.title: Oracle VM VirtualBox
channel.description: I have installed VirtualBox one of my computers. I also downloaded the .iso file for Zorin. I'm having the VirtualBox read the .iso file, and the computer starts up and works fine and everything, except for the fact that all files and data gets deleted off the virtual machine once I power it off. I've installed the operating system to the VirtualBox and it still doesn't save. Zorin is 1.1GB and I only have a 800MB blank disc, which is why I haven't installed it to a new computer. How can I make the VirtualBox save the data + files that's on Zorin? Thanks.

item.title: Oracle VM VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

save the hdd contents

Read full topic

@Fridder wrote:

it should if you’re not running a live cd…

It should what? Erase every time I turn it off?

I have installed VirtualBox one of my computers. I also downloaded the .iso file for Zorin. I’m having the VirtualBox read the .iso file, and the computer starts up and works fine and everything, except for the fact that all files and data gets deleted off the virtual machine once I power it off. How can I make the VirtualBox save the data + files that’s on Zorin? Thanks.
